title: Panglima Perang
author: Panglima Perang
content: Dear all, Here my friend got trouble with his account was hack and he can't used post proof trough Blockchain bitcoin address wallet because always use with Binance segwit BTC address, Seems Binance not available for signed message Bitcoin, Any one have ideas how to signed message trough Ethereum Network? my friend used metamask address for post proof on several bounties campaign.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Panglima Perang on September 28, 2022, 02:31:45 AMSeems Binance not available for signed message Bitcoin,In order to sign a message with a Bitcoin address you have to own that bitcoin address (i.e. to be yours and only yours).Binance and the other exchanges give you an account. The address is theirs, although associated to your account. Since it's not yours, you cannot sign with it.You can download Electrum (it would be good if you would make sure you get it from Electrum.org and also verify it), make a new wallet, make sure you keep safe the seed of that wallet, get one of the addresses and sign a message with it.For Ethereum I can't help.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Panglima Perang on September 28, 2022, 02:31:45 AMAny one have ideas how to signed message trough Ethereum Network? my friend used metamask address for post proof on several bounties campaign.Being able to sign a message from an eth address that has been posted on this forum should suffice, there's no point in writing the binance's bitcoin address.Btw, if signing an ether address is considered valid on this forum then your friend is in luck, I hardly found anyone ever using this method for account recovery.

comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on September 28, 2022, 06:21:50 AM-snip-Being able to sign a message from an eth address that has been posted on this forum should suffice, there's no point in writing the binance's bitcoin address.Btw, if signing an ether address is considered valid on this forum then your friend is in luck, I hardly found anyone ever using this method for account recovery.I'm also not sure whether sign messages other than BTC address and PGP key for Bitcointalk account recovery will be accepted or not.Quote from: theymos on December 26, 2018, 03:48:07 PMOften, you need to prove ownership of the account with a PGP or Bitcoin signature. -snip-However, I've read the following global moderator statement:Quote from: hilariousandco on May 08, 2018, 03:45:27 PMQuote from: riky95 on May 08, 2018, 01:45:19 PMPlease tell me which method you prefer, I think I have enough proofs and is obvious that is my account.A signed message from a bitcoin address is likely the only thing that is going to get your account back. If you can't provide that then you should at least try sort the ethereum one out. Maybe the OP (his friend) can try it if he has never posted a bitcoin address from a non-custodial wallet.@OP, I've tried to create an eth address sign message: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=3383051.msg35709111#msg35709111. You can see the full tutorial in the first post by @setaw on that thread.
